well he still on his schedule so he still sleeps until 11 get up with the kids and still also put them to bed yesterday had breakdown because project was working on fell through why because get hardly stressed enough know it not entirely his choice do try and empathise grateful for him he good father but am really frustrated just needed to vent do feel like can talk to anyone about this removed know how you feel mama know how you feel know the feeling can imagine that being sustainable for years lose my mind my husband works which really means leave the house at usually before the baby 10 months gets up and then get home about 30 minutes before bedtime at 7pm he also on call 24 so he can even take her solo on weekends glad he able to provide for us but it so hard to be the only one doing all the baby care housework and errands removed don know what to suggest but would be sick of that situation too any possible way you could get away for weekend or have the kids visit friend or family member for weekend yep my husband leaves before our son wakes up in the morning and usually gets home well after he goes to bed it sucks for all of us he basically only gets to see kiddo on the weekends definitely not alone my husband works 10hr shift 40 minutes away he gets up at 0530 and gets home at 1830 on good day he sees the kids for two hours before bedtime and usually by then ready for bed too do it all with three kids in tow my four year old is special needs ve done all the paperwork gotten him into all his therapies do all the doctor appointments all the teacher meetings dishes laundry cleaning dinner also in the reserves to maintain health insurance for my kids so somehow find time to work out my hobbies are nonexistent we get testy about it every once in awhile who deserves the free time more on my drill weekends don feel bad for those two or three days he lives the life do every single day there have been plenty of nights one of the grandmas have taken the kids we get whole weekend occasionally it been nine years so there have been breaks in there but the problem itself never changes ha like that would feel bad either good luck guys yep hubby works mon fri in different city or in different country he leaves in the early hours on monday mornings and gets home at 1am on saturday morning usually on the rare occasion he gets to work from home it has been really isolating the past years since having our firstborn am now in the early stages of pregnancy with our second alone with morning sickness feel like am gunna snap do have friends or family in the area who can help look after ds while wretch in the bathroom and help look after me too really feeling like he needs career change but that would require massive paycut at least we are debt free for now till we buy house do know how you ve dealt with that schedule for so long my husband usually gets home around our daughter typically goes to bed 7:45 some nights he has work dinners or he plays with his band so he does get home till much later and that drives me nuts doing tours of daycares without him next week because he wo take the time off work it infuriates me try to be sympathetic because know he working hard to provide but also working and taking care the baby and waking up multiple times night with her and it all just overwhelming sometimes just want help or break the perception that you re responsible for it all is what needs to change yes he providing financially but where is he emotionally does he bond connect with the kids with you does he pitch in around the house to provide you break my husband had to spend full 24 hour with the kids to understand my day responsibilities he changed after that might be tricky with his work schedule but weekend day maybe after nine years any possibility of shift change good luck my husband just went to bed tonight at wtf he doesnt even get up with the baby at night and he thinks he gets to go to be at you dont think deserve to lay down ugh men yesssss my husband leaves the house at 6:45 am and gets home at 7:15pm he has an hour and fifteen min commute both ways thankfully he only works mon thurs so fridays are his day with our toddler work mon friday and lucky me gets to do all pick ups drop offs appointments car maintenance grocery shopping cleaning dinners lunches packing daycare bags ect and even when he is home our child wants me to do everything because that is what she is used to he sees our daughter for maybe half hour before bedtime and then he eats dinner while do bath pjs brush teeth then it is supposed to be him putting her to sleep sometimes he is really good about it and just does it other times have to call him up and ask if he is going to put her to bed our social life is non existant during the week and then we try to jam in as much as we can during the weekends by monday the house is disaster and get to start off my work week with huge to do list long for the days when could get up before work and get myself ready and just go he wakes up 15 mins before he has to leave have to wake up get myself ready and then do it again on tiny human who would prefer to do anything other then what say high five to the rest of you super moms how do we do this day after day his job has been making empty promises for years about moving him to first shift now they re down to months it ll happen eventually first shift is very competitive and they do want to lose him as an employee but he put all this time in and if he moves to another company he ll start at the bottom and it will be numerous years to come we re debt free as well aside from the house it good place to be that rough about the morning sickness and the newborn though newborns are hard very true after nine years wouldn want to leave it all behind hoping it happens soon for your sanity and family sake think it easy for men or non mothers to assume that staying home with the kids is break my own dad father of 8pm times week he gets sleep day before shift and then is away at work getting up with her 15mo breakfast dressed etc playing with her for the day etc giving her bath getting her to sleep don get to just say working tomorrow getting sleep night just have to sleep whenever she does and when you re up at and she sleeping at the back of 11 that sucks the one dropping her off and picking her up when particularly enjoy the exercise enjoy the hour hour and half get to myself wander around the supermarket next to the gym just because it gets me some extra alone time oof be fuming as well thank you your husband sounds like good father but it does sound like he thinking about your needs as his partner bringing home the bacon is not more important job that keeping the household running much less caring for two kids not to mention the part time work move over wonder woman mrs beanmagician is here certainly sympathize with feeling like you re doing everything my husband works similar shift and much of the kid stuff falls to me get overwhelmed and we only have one and she only months but he has tweaked his day so that he can be as involved as possible now that he dad his shift is 330 12 and he is usually home by 1230 he goes to sleep by because he does sleep in all morning wake up early with our daughter but he up by 830 usually so that he can either go to his second job or help around the house be an active participant in our family life on days off from his main job he goes to bed with me 11 1130 and wakes up with me or so and our daughter and on these days he works his second job sometimes he wakes up and takes care of her so that can sleep in bit and he can bond with her more he also works second job most mornings so days per week really running the show solo completely sympathize with feeling alone and overwhelmed though do have nearly decade of it under my belt that sounds exhausting it seems like there are steps your husband can take that could absolutely help even this playing field for one why is your husband staying up so late my husband used to stay up late to wind down pre baby but now he listens to meditations or classical music on the drive home so that he can relax zen out and be ready for sleep when he gets home and he does sleep in late just because he could sleep the night before that perpetuates later sleep cycle and since you husbands works 10s does he get days off if so that even more reason for him not to be sleeping until 11am goodness if that the case almost half his week he could have normal family life why is he choosing that it sounds like all need to have talk when you re both in good mood the kids are around do be afraid to be vulnerable tell him you feel overwhelmed that you re exhausted and need his help and suggest he tweak his schedule bit to better accommodate \*your\* needs as you ve certainly switched yours around to fit his if my husband saw this post he would think it is about him except for two kids and how long you ve been doing it our one kid is 16mo he works 12 sleeps in on the weekend at least one day will wake him up early if there are things to do all can do is push harder on the weekends to get him to do more it so hard because he is the breadwinner but it feels very unequal in terms of caring for our child know work less and make less but he does want to hear that he needs to do more know you re right about this but we ve had these conversations either ca fully articulate in the moment my full reasoning or he just plain thinks wrong usually *i m* the one who winds up feeling like
